content: row tail w&t row 40 work in pattern for 2 stitches sw turn in the row above you will be making the sw so that there will be 1 stitch between the last sw you made and the new one almost final tail round knit to end of round working sw as single stitches final tail round knit all the way around working sw as single stitches if you d like to put stuffing into the tail stop about 3/4 of the way across the next row add stuffing and then finish bind off tail divide & finish divide stitches evenly 40 on each onto 2 needles with wrong sides together do a 3 needle bind off hat #43 fish adult size v1 2 the dorsal fin on the top of the fish lay the fish flat so that the bor is at the bottom where way-back-when you tied those little scraps of yarn to remind you not to put the dorsal fin there go to the other side opposite these markers - this will be the top of the fish pick up 16 stitches in 2 columns there is a mini tutorial with some pictures at the end here s how you do that 1 measure about 5 from the base of the tail and thread a little scrap of yarn through 2 columns so you can see which ones you are working with 2 take a thinner smaller gauge dpn and pick up one leg of each stitch going down until you have 16 3 slide the stitches from the dpn onto a long circular needle 4 slide the stitches onto the cable portion of the circular needle this will put less pressure onto the stitches while you are picking up the second column 5 take the dpn and pick up one leg of each stitch going down until you have 16 the second column is much tighter and harder to do a small pointy needle is helpful in catching the stitch and lifting it onto the dpn 6 take the same circular needle and slide the stitches from the dpn onto the circular needle 7 put the needles onto the ready position for magic loop you re ready to go add in your fin color yarn and work the following rounds just as you did when working the base of the tail you are working using the magic loop method but you are working the sides separately attach a piece of scrap yarn or a locking stitch marker to show where you begin knitting so you ll know for sure when you ve completed a round i ve written the fin rounds in 2 parts so you can put a check mark beside them as you work them to help you keep track dorsal fin round 1 side a k16 side b k16 32 stitches total / 16 each side dorsal fin round 2 side a * k1 kfb * side b * k1 kfb * 48
